text: While agencies such as Treasury and the Small Business Administration (SBA) are working to roll out #CARESAct programs as quickly as possible, I hope the information in my column will be helpful to you in this challenging time: https://t.co/loMznouPYl

On Wednesday afternoon I will be hosting a webinar for #NE03 small businesses and lenders to hear from SBA about PPP and other programs in the #CARESAct.  Preregistration is required, and can be done here>>> https://t.co/9hlPTqUSot

Nebraskans have taken drastic, but necessary measures to stop the spread of COVID-19, and it is clear a major disaster declaration is appropriate. I appreciate the leadership of @GovRicketts and @POTUS at this difficult time. My statement here: https://t.co/Q2QWM4ZaHv
SBA is currently working to activate any lenders who previously had access to their CAFS system.

Banks, Credit Unions, and other SBA lenders in #NE03 – I am working with Treasury to address online issues with CARES. If you are having trouble connecting please call my Washington or Grand Island office ASAP so we can ensure your concerns are addressed. https://t.co/pUhrjOf8A5

Despite the crucial role our cattle producers play in feeding our nation during #COVID19 they are now having to weather low prices and market volatility. Because of this, I wrote to @USDA urging immediate assistance for cattle producers. My statement here: https://t.co/5YteTR6wQa

Breaking news: @USTreasury has announced seniors on #SocialSecurity DO NOT need to file a tax return to receive their $1,200 economic impact payments.  Thank you @stevenmnuchin1 and @RealDonaldTrump for making this common sense change! https://t.co/UPbahiJeJL

Reminder – Today is National #CensusDay so make sure to check your mailboxes  and send out the census form if you haven’t already. You can also go online at https://t.co/qIXIUcyjk9 .The Census is key to ensuring Nebraska has a voice in our government!

Seniors on Social Security and other US citizens who don’t typically file a tax return are eligible for $1,200 economic impact payments under the CARES Act. In order to qualify, you must file a simple 2019 tax return. IRS will be provide more info at https://t.co/lq4ZfoWr8u

Last week we passed the #CARESAct which provides assistance to Americans with tax relief, expanded unemployment benefits for those who need it, and helps our businesses stay afloat so we can resume a strong economy when the pandemic subsides. My column: https://t.co/JsFMoPT1F7

Glad to support the #CARESAct because it provides tax relief, benefits for those who need it, and helps our businesses stay afloat. I worked to ensure rural America was not left behind and am pleased it addresses key issues in that area. My statement here: https://t.co/YbzOnZwJAT
RT @NETNewsNebraska: .@RepAdrianSmith says the House will have questions about the #stimulusbill, but says there seems to be agreement on m…

Technologies such as #telehealth are critical to providing Medicare beneficiaries health care access while preventing unnecessary risks to those most vulnerable. Because of this, @RepOHalleran and I led a letter supporting telehealth in the #COVID19 package. https://t.co/r3UKXvGeja

Today on #NationalAgDay we owe our ag producers a great deal of thanks for all they do to feed the world. During the #COVID19 outbreak, we have seen first-hand the importance of food production and how much we rely on our producers. Thank you!

While the COVID-19 outbreak continues, drastic measures have been put in place to slow the spread. Due to the seriousness of this issue, @POTUS has taken actions to keep us safe. My column here:  https://t.co/rR3KhoCGKO

Due to health and safety concerns with COVID-19, the upcoming public events in Hebron, Falls City, Geneva, Pawnee City and Arthur have been postponed. Please contact my office via https://t.co/DUWpuzCTAS if you need assistance or to share your concerns. #NE03 https://t.co/rbEBvZc5HU

Thank you, @realDonaldTrump for cutting red tape for ethanol producers to make alcohol for much-needed hand sanitizer, and for motor carriers who are transporting essential supplies and equipment.  Rural America stands ready to help fight #COVID19.
Important update – The IRS has postponed the tax filing deadline to July 15. I appreciate @realDonaldTrump and @stevenmnuchin1 for their decisive actions in providing relief for the American people.

New alert from @SocialSecurity Inspector General - While SSA is providing telephone service only due to COVID-19, any claims of a benefit cut because of Coronavirus are a scam. More info here - https://t.co/Uzqx2j6meq

Because of the COVID-19 national emergency, Treasury has deferred tax payment deadlines by 90 days.  This deadline only applies to payments – the tax filing deadline remains April 15.  More info here: https://t.co/PcMj3AF9mq

US-Kenya negotiations are an important opportunity to develop a first-rate agreement as a model for future trade with our AGOA partners. Very pleased @USTradeRep and @RealDonaldTrump have taken another important step toward starting these talks. https://t.co/Pc4ndzYyW7

Reminder – Veterans who believe they are experiencing COVID-19 symptoms should contact their local VA health facility by telephone, not immediately go there in person. More Coronavirus info for veterans can be found here: https://t.co/KsXI1xN3gz

Americans are rightfully taking steps to protect themselves, their families, friends, and neighbors from transmission of #coronavirus and I am grateful for the leadership of @realDonaldTrump during this trying time. My column here:  https://t.co/QlUnoSoNBT
.@POTUS has released important recommendations for slowing the spread of COVID-19.  Please read, and stay safe!  https://t.co/JJ7Sni0Eka

Due to health and safety concerns with COVID-19, Saturday’s Service Academy Open House at @kearneylib is postponed. For assistance with the academy nomination process, please contact my Grand Island office.  #NE03 https://t.co/oioX1UlLIS

Due to health & safety concerns with COVID-19, along with recommendation of social distancing from @POTUS, @GovRicketts, @CDCgov, & out of an abundance of caution, my office will be postponing tomorrow’s Staff Mobile Office in Kimball. #NE03 https://t.co/mqHyxkNZye

Glad to introduce the RUSH Act with @SenJohnThune @RepAnnieKuster @SenatorCardin which will help transform rural health care and improve lives by helping eliminate unnecessary travel for seniors in nursing homes. https://t.co/havXTjBWeW

My staff will host Caseworker in your Community stops in Albion, Verdigre, and Fullerton today. If you need help with the VA, Social Security, Medicare, USCIS, IRS, FEMA, other federal agencies, please stop by. #NE03 https://t.co/3CdsEpzBSl

My staff will host a Mobile Office in Loup City today. Please stop by if you need help with FEMA, USDA, FSA, VA, Medicare, or other federal agencies, or have thoughts to share. #NE03 https://t.co/9R1G7BG20o
Always great to meet with the @LegioninNE and hear directly from veterans their comments and concerns. Thank you for your service to our great country! #NE03 https://t.co/29Kv9hKvyO

The Congressional Art Competition is open to all high school students in Nebraska’s 3rd District. I am always impressed with the skill and creativity of Nebraska’s young people, and I look forward to seeing this year’s entries. Visit my website for more info. #NE03 https://t.co/KzPBn3dnJT

My staff will host Mobile Offices in York and Hyannis today. Please stop by if you need help with FEMA, USDA, FSA, VA, Medicare, or other federal agencies, or have thoughts to share. #NE03 https://t.co/GFEXA1vNXr

Andrea and I are honored to attend the @FaithandPolitic Pilgrimage in Alabama highlighting the Civil Rights movement in our country. Coming together for moments such as this truly make America better. https://t.co/RCeYdxkQgy
. @TheSSAOIG has named today National “Slam the Scam” Day to warn Americans about #SocialSecurity scam texts. Stay vigilant and find more information here: https://t.co/60pxjzA7qX

. @POTUS has been adamant from the very beginning we must take #coronavirus seriously. The package we passed today in the House will be critical to preventing the spread of this disease. My statement here: https://t.co/F6ivpyiLDX
Enjoyed the opportunity to show @nebr_christian seniors around the Capitol this morning! https://t.co/IOJ5mWgmQp
Always great to see @NEFarmBureau when they are DC. Agriculture, small businesses, and trade are the lifeblood of the Nebraska economy! #NE03 https://t.co/ufiQs7P2NC

I am excited to relaunch the #GoodLifeShowcase and see the beauty of rural Nebraska as captured by Nebraskans. Please submit an original photo of #NE03 with your name, location and a brief description to TheGoodLifeShowcase@mail.house.gov. More info here: https://t.co/GVE1x5ammG https://t.co/ukZ6wBJUVN

Because timeliness is key in fights against infectious diseases like #coronovirus we must come up with a bipartisan solution as soon as possible. I thank @realDonaldTrump for his quick action in this fight. My column here: https://t.co/vlIuuF04MN
Today I recognized Gering-Scottsbluff for being named a Top Western Town by @TrueWestMag – an honor well deserved! Watch my remarks here: https://t.co/Yl7NcD4UKC

Enjoyed meeting with Members of the Kenyan Parliament this week. #Kenya represents an opportunity for the United States to start building on AGOA by developing first-rate trade agreements with African nations. https://t.co/LMdKDnCsd6

At today’s @WaysandMeansGOP hearing, I asked @SecAzar about the administration’s response to the #coronavirus and discussed the key role @unmc plays in efforts to combat this virus. Watch my remarks here: https://t.co/M389gYeDsz

My website, like most congressional websites, is currently down and we are currently looking into it. No timetable yet but hopefully will be back up and running soon – thank you for your patience!

Great turnout and conversation coffee with the Crete Area Chamber of Commerece. #NE03 https://t.co/Nh11TH3X4W
Best wishes to Jane Monnich who is retiring after 45 years from @KLINRadio ! It was great to work with Jane over the years and I wish her and her husband well in their next chapter.
Great meeting with @LexSchools administrators and students yesterday. #NE03 https://t.co/F5YQQA8MUo
Engaging conversation at the @CozadChamber coffee yesterday. Many thanks to those who attended. #NE03 https://t.co/GD4ntl2WBK
Agriculture is the number one U.S. trade constituency, and any trade deal with the EU and the UK must include it. My Op-Ed with @RodneyDavis here: https://t.co/gJ8HlAgmOp

We want US companies to do business across as many countries as possible, not target profits solely into tax havens. TCJA was written to accomplish that goal, and Treasury regs got it right. My remarks from yesterday’s @WaysandMeansGOP hearing here: https://t.co/e5hS3lbeBV

While we faced our share of challenges over the past year in Nebraska, I agree with the President’s assessment at the State of the Union that “America’s future is blazing bright.” My column here: https://t.co/afv3trZxkE

This afternoon the House passed the Protecting America's Food & Agriculture Act. I cosponsored this bill because the U.S. needs more ag customs inspectors to maintain our high standards by protecting our nation’s livestock from destructive diseases like African Swine Fever.

In tonight’s #SOTU the President presented an optimistic agenda to continue growing economic opportunity for all Americans. My statement here: https://t.co/UDckBPAfBS

Yesterday @RepGwenMoore and I introduced a bill to ensure guarantee insurance on municipal bonds remains available to states and localities while leaving intact strong anti-abuse language from TCJA which prevents foreign tax shelters from pretending to be insurance companies.

Even with revenue at record highs, the primary focus of the Ways and Means majority continues to be raising taxes to pay for even more spending. My column here: https://t.co/n9o3sg1tfR

I joined my colleagues on the #BiofuelsCaucus in writing @SecretarySonny to support the new Higher Blends Infrastructure Incentive Program. Further investment in biofuels gives consumers more choices at the pump!

Yesterday I met with Col. John Hudson, U.S. Corps of Engineers Omaha District Commander. He provided an update on current repair and rehab efforts, and provided information which will be useful as I work with state and local officials to address our river management challenges. https://t.co/NteL3vQtDs

Every year on the anniversary of Roe v. Wade, people travel to Washington, D.C. from all over the United States to demonstrate peacefully on behalf of the unborn, showing the spirit to defend life has never diminished in our country. My column here: https://t.co/oe5pFmWgZE

Replacing the onerous #WOTUS rule empowers states to regulate their non-navigable waters and is much more aligned with the original intent of the law. Once again, @realDonaldTrump fulfills his promise to rein in the federal government.
Yesterday I toured the expanded facilities at Royal Engineered Composites of Minden.  Thank you! #NE03 https://t.co/XC3GJkDN2T

Last week I had the honor of attending @POTUS and Chinese Vice Premier signing the phase one trade agreement between our nations. While we know there is more to be done, we should celebrate what has been accomplished. My column here: https://t.co/Hf1plzLND5

I enjoyed attending @KACCNebraska’s 101st Annual Meeting yesterday as they recognized a diverse array of community leaders. Congratulations to my staff member, Alex Straatmann, for being among those recognized! #NE03 https://t.co/XTEzTad60d
An incredible Kearney sunrise on a crisp Nebraska morning! https://t.co/zbseFiT7tb

I was honored to visit with residents of the Central Nebraska Veterans Home yesterday. I was thankful for the opportunity to join them in Freedom Hall, to share in viewing, “Reflections of Service,” the newest statue located near their fishing pond. #NE03 https://t.co/TqqSoJQIbw
